title_main:
See the contradiction first,
then decide whether to believe.
subtitle_main: Pause for a moment—your mind will spot what doesn't add up.

lines:
If it's so easy to make money, why isn't he making it himself?
Why does he need you?
If profit is guaranteed, that's insider trading—not investment advice.
Anyone who tells you to “keep it secret” is afraid the truth will break the spell.
When returns are always higher than risks, it's because the risks are all on you.
An investment that needs you to constantly add more—who is really being invested in?
People who truly make money in the market don’t earn it by recruiting students.
Someone who loves you but can never meet you—does that make sense?
A person who won’t even take a call claims to understand you the most?
The faster someone pushes the relationship, the more they’re chasing an opportunity—not you.
Someone who shows up only when you're vulnerable isn’t caring for you.
A genuine partner won’t ask you for money, much less put you at risk.
If you can’t even verify their basic identity, are you sure they exist?
The government will never send you to an ATM. Only scammers do that.
Real police officers will find you in person, not pressure you over the phone.
Banks will never ask for your verification code. That code protects you.
People who insist you must act “right now” don’t want you to think.
Real issues come with official documents, not LINE messages.
A real account doesn’t fear verification—the ones that do are the problem.
